document_data.name: Trobriand's Glassteel
document_data.refs3e:
{{Cite web enhancement/Vanrakdoom|15}}{{cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Trobriand's Glassteel (Krashos)}}{{cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Trobriand's Glassteel (Boyd)}}''Vanrakdoom'' makes mention of a spell named ''Trobriand's Glassteel'', and references it as being part of ''City of Splendors'', but no such spell appears in the book or any of its attendant materials.
While 3rd edition books seem to prefer the use of [[glassteel]] as a material, as Eric L. Boyd is credited as an author on both ''Races of Faerun'' and ''Champions of Valor'', where glassteel as a material is introduced both to 3rd edition and to 3.5, the inclusion of the spell can only be considered deliberate.
Upon inquiry, a detail provided by George Krashos on Candlekeep, and confirmed by Eric L. Boyd, author of both ''Vanrakdoom'' and ''City of Splendors'', adds the details assumed here.
document_data.Effects: Materials affected by the spell were hardened to the strength of iron or steel,{{Cite web enhancement/Vanrakdoom|15}} likely also made more transparent.{{cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Trobriand's Glassteel (Krashos)}}
document_data.Components: Per records from sages familiar with the matter, the spell was akin to ''glassteel'' and possessed both [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components, as well as requiring a small piece of iron as its [[material component]].
document_data.History: The spell was ostensibly developed by [[Trobriand]]. It had been used to reinforce several [[chalcedony]] statues in [[Vanrakdoom]] at some point on or prior to {{yearlink|1372}}.{{Cite web enhancement/Vanrakdoom|15}}
